field.note: This is the URL to grab the contents from. This only works for a webpage. Please supply the a complete URL, together with protocol, i.e. http://www.this.com
Select this option if you want links in the target page to open within the remote page.
If Replace Links is selected, this option will make sure that only the links to the Remote URL domain name specified above get replaced. Links to remote sites will be left intact.

If enabled, this asset will redirect to the necessary location automatically. It is important to leave this YES in the general case because many sites do silent redirects. If a redirect is required and this is set to NO, you will get an Error Message

If not using HTTP authentication, leave this blank. Please note that HTTP Authentication will not properly work in the mixed content environments. This means that although this asset will be able to obtain the bare HTML page from the remote source, the images and other includes will be requested by the web browser (not this asset) so the user will be prompted to authenticate as well.
Content on the remote page will be discarded until this tag is reached. You can use standard HTML elements or define your own tag to use (for examle <--start-->).

After the Start Tag has been encountered, all the content on the remote page will be captures until this tag is reached. You can use standard HTML elements or define your own tag to use (for examle <--end-->). If this tag is not found, everything is captured till the end of page.

If the content cannot be retrieved within the specified period, an error message will be displayed. This value must be non-negative. If you try to submit a negative number, it will be changed to the default value.
